• Small javascript framework built on top of jQuery.
  • RESTful Evented JavaScript.
  • A way of allowing you to respond to specific URLS.
  • A way of creating single page applications that still respond to the back button

• Written By Aaron Quint
  • AQ, wanted to give developers a way to easily define routes and structure within an application
  • Originally wanted to create sinatra in javascript, but the api has developed into more this

• Sammy applications revolve around the concept of a route.
  • A route consists of 3 arguments: verb, path and callback
  • Routes exist as part of a Sammy application and can be bound to custom events

• Routes exits as part of an application
  • An application can be setup by passing a function to $.sammy
  • $.sammy is a shortcut to the Sammy.Application constructor
  • Within the application this represents the application and is used to create and configure routes

//Define the application

		  var app = $.sammy(function() {
		    
		   //Create a route
		    this.get('#/', function() {
		      $('body').append('Merry Christmas!');	
		    });
    
		  });
		  
		  //run the application with the default route specified
		  (function() {
		    app.run('#/');
		  })();

• There are four verbs available to the developer: get, post, put & delete
  • These behave like their http namesakes
  • Three of the four available routes (put, post, delete) are only triggered on form submission.
